ResponsibilitiesBASIC SUMMARY: Acts as a Study Analyst by performing method development, validation, implementation and documentation of bioanalytical assays in support of protein therapeutics for pharmacokinetics along with immunogenicity assays for possible host antibodies using immunochemical techniques within GLP and non-GLP environments under the supervision of a Principal Investigator/Study Director. Responsible for the technical conduct of assigned laboratory studies, as well as for the analysis, documentation and reporting of results. Adheres to company SOPs and applicable federal regulations in performance and documentation of laboratory work and use of equipment. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: o Follows approved bioanalytical procedures and study protocol/bioanalytical plan to perform bioanalytical assays.  o Records documentation for bioanalytical assays in compliance with applicable WIL Research SOPs and bioanalytical procedures, and ensures that documentation is a complete, correct record of the experiments performed.  o Meets daily with Supervisor to discuss daily laboratory activities to ensure scheduled work is executed as planned/directed by the appropriate SD/PI/BI.  o Ensures reagents/equipment are being used in an appropriate manner according to requirements for calibration/expiration/storage etc. Ensures appropriate reagents/equipment are being utilized per the procedures being followed.  o Notifies Study Director/Principal Investigator if bioanalytical procedure or study protocol/bioanalytical plan is not followed, or if mistakes occur, or if a run fails to meet acceptance criteria.  o Follows Project Checklist and works with Study Director/Principal Investigator to ensure that the raw data file is complete for the study.  o Helps to compile validation or bioanalytical results to be included in the final report.  o Helps to write the bioanalytical procedures and run checklists.  o Performs instrument monitor duties, as required.  o Records appropriate data/information from all experiments in Bioanalytical Metrics file on at least a weekly basis. Works with Site Operations group to meet client timelines by performing other duties as required by a team member.Performs cell culture procedures, as required.QualificationsB.S. or B.A. in biology/biochemistry/chemistry or a closely-related discipline.0-2 years of experience in a laboratory settingAwareness of Good Laboratory Practice Regulations. Good oral and written communication skills. Able to perform work in a timely manner.
